effect: • **Sundering**
Enemies in Short Range suffer -1 to Morale Test rolls. If this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, they suffer -2 instead.
Each time an enemy in Short Range loses a rank, this unit restores 1 Wound. If this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, that enemy becomes **Panicked**.
This unit may have up to 3 Pillage tokens.
Each time this unit performs a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice, Choose 1 for each Pillage token on this unit:
**• Critical Blow**
**• Sundering**
**• Vicious**
**• Precision**
• **Precision**

• After completing a Melee Attack, you may remove any number of Pillage tokens from this unit. If you removed at least 1 token, this unit restores 1 Wound, +2 Wounds for each token removed beyond the first.
• **Sundering**
If this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, it may re-roll any Attack Dice.
Each time a friendly NCU Claims [MONEY], 1 Blacktyde Chosen unit gains 1 Pillage token.
While this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, all friendly units in Short Range gain +1 to Morale Test rolls and suffer -1 Wound from failing Panic Tests.

Each time this unit performs a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice, if this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, the Defender becomes **Panicked** and, if they fail the Panic Test from this Attack, suffer +1 Wound.
If this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, it gains +1 to Defense Dice rolls.
Target 1 enemy within Short Range and Line of Sight of this unit. They become **Vulnerable** or **Weakened**. If this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, they become both instead.
• **Sundering**
• If this unit has at least 2 Pillage tokens, when performing an Attack, before rolling Attack Dice, the Defender becomes **Panicked**.

While engaged by an enemy with the same remaining ranks, this unit may re-roll all Panic Test dice. While engaged by an enemy with fewer remaining ranks, this unit automatically passes all Panic Tests.
This unit may perform 1 Melee Attack Action.
Target 1 friendly Greyjoy Combat unit in Short Range. You may remove 1 friendly attached card from that unit and then attach it to another friendly Greyjoy unit in Short Range of them.
Before rolling Attack Dice, choose 1:
• The Defender becomes **Weakened**.
• Attach 1 Dornish Poison card to the Defender.
• When Attacking **Weakened** enemies, this Attack gains **Vicious** and may re-roll any Attack Dice.
• Enemies successfully Charged gain 1 Condition token.
• **Sundering**
• When Charging, rolls +2 Attack Dice for each remaining ranks in this unit.
• If Attacking an enemy in the Flank or Rear, before rolling Attack Dice, that enemy becomes **Panicked**, **Vulnerable**, and **Weakened**.
If your opponent does not Control [CROWN], when this unit is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice, the Defender becomes **Panicked** and **Weakened**.

This unit cannot perform Retreat actions. When this unit activates, if it can Charge an enemy, it performs 1 Charge Action on the nearest valid enemy and counts as rolling a 6 for all Charge Distance Dice.
This unit may always re-roll Charge Distance dice.

ORDER: DEPARTING STRIKE.trigger: When this unit performs a Retreat Action, before resolving that Action:
effect: This unit performs 1 Melee Attack Action using its lowest Attack Die Value.

After completing this Attack, the Defender becomes **Panicked**. If this Attack destroyed an enemy rank, instead all enemies in Short Range become **Panicked**. If any enemies were already **Panicked**, they instead become **Weakened**.

ORDER: PRICE OF FAILURE.trigger: When this unit is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: All Attack Dice rolls automatically Hit for this Attack. For each Attack Die roll of 1, this unit suffers 1 Wound.
Each time a friendly NCU Claims [CROWN], you may replace that zone's effect with:
*Search your Tactics Deck or Discard Pile for 1 of Daenerys' Commander cards and add it to your hand. Shuffle your Tactics Deck.*
• After deployment target 1 enemy unit. When Charging that enemy, this unit may re-roll any Charge Distance dice.
• While your opponent does not Control [SWORDS], each time this unit performs a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice, the Defender becomes **Vulnerable**.
When another friendly Combat Unit in Short Range would be destroyed, you may destroy Barristan. If you do, that Unit is not destroyed but remains in play with 1 Wound.
• While you Control [MONEY], may re-roll any Attack Dice.
• While you Control [LETTER], before rolling Attack Dice, the Defender becomes **Vulnerable**.
• While you Control [SWORDS], gains **Sundering**.
The first time this unit would become **Weakened**, it does not gain that token.
• This unit has 4 Wounds.
• At the start of this unit’s Activation, it may perform 1 Maneuver or Retreat Action.
• As long as Jorah is on the battlefield, increase your Tactics Hand Size limit by +1. You start the game with 4 cards and may draw up to 4 cards when refilling your hand.
When your opponent Claims [CROWN], you may search your Tactics deck for 1 *Rush of Aggression* or *Reckless Fury* card, and add it to your hand. If you do, shuffle your Tactics deck.
Your army may include 1 Stannis Baratheon Commander Attachment.
When this unit is performing a Melee Attack, becore rolling Attack Dice, choose 1 for each friendly unit in Short Range:
• **Precision**
• **Sundering**
• The Defender gains 1 Condition token
Once per game, after a friendly unit in Short Range is Attacked, you may immediately trigger any number of differently named Orders and Tactic cards with an "after Attack" trigger.
You count as Controlling [CROWN].
While your opponent does not Control [CROWN], this unit may re-roll any Morale Test dice.
This unit begins the game with 1 **Faith token**. Each time it passes a Morale Test, it gains 1 Faith token. Faith tokens may be expended to do the following:
**• When this unit performs a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:** This Attack gains **Vicious**.
**• After this unit completes a Melee Attack: **This unit restores 1 Wound, +1 Wound for each of the Defender’s destroyed ranks.
**• When this unit performs a Charge Action, before resolving that action:** This unit may re-roll any Charge Distance Dice, and any enemies they successfully charge become **Panicked**.
When another friendly unit in Short Range performs a Panic Test, before rolling dice, this unit may pivot and shift 2".
When performing this Attack, before rolling Attack Dice, choose 1 for each Game Round beyond the first Round:
**• Critical Blow**
**• Vicious**
**• Sundering**
**•** Deals +1 Hit for each of this unit’s remaining ranks. *(You may only choose this option starting in Round 5)*
Enemies engaged with this unit do not Control Objectives if they have the same remaining ranks as this unit.
While your opponent does not Control [CROWN], opponents cannot expend **Vulnerable** on this unit, and this unit's Melee Attacks gain **Vicious**.
If you would discard friendly attached Night's Watch cards from this unit as a result of failing a Panic Test, you must only discard 1 of those cards of your choice.
• This unit has 8 Wounds.
• This unit cannot Control Objectives.
• This unit cannot Charge, Retreat, or Shift.
• **Vicious**
• Measures Range and Line of Sight from any part of this unit's tray.
• Defenders do not roll Defense Dice.
• If the Defender is Cavalry, Monster or War Machine unit, this Attack gains +1 to Hit and rolls +1 Attack Dice.
• Enemies cannot expend **Weakened** tokens while performing this Attack.
• Cannot Attack Solo units. Suffers -1 to Hit when attacking Cavalry units.
• May Attack enemies regardless of range and Line of Sight.
• If this Attack generates any Hits, instead of rolling Defense Dice, the Defender suffers 2 Wounds.
• After completing this Attack, the Defender suffers -1 [MOVEMENT] and -2 Morale until the end of the Round.

ORDER: ADAPTIVE STYLE.trigger: When this unit Attacks or is Attacked, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect:
Choose 1:
• This unit gains +1 to Defense Dice rolls and +2 to Panic Test rolls until the end of the Round.
• This Attack gains **Critical Blow** and **Sundering**.
After an enemy completes a Range Attack on this unit, this unit may pivot and shift 2".
After Deployment, you may search your Tactics deck for 1 *Battle Endurance* or *Walrus Strength* card and attach it to this unit. Shuffle your tactics deck.

ORDER: PLANNED APPROACH.trigger: When a friendly unit in Long Range Activates:
effect: Until the end of the Turn, that unit may not be targeted by enemy effects or abilities.
This unit counts as containing Harma for abilities and effects.
• **Vicious**
• **Sundering**
• If the Defender is a Cavalry, Monster or War Machine unit, this Attack gains +1 to Hit and rolls +1 Attack Die.
**• Ranged Only:** Defenders do not roll Defense Dice.
• This unit has 8 Wounds.
• This unit cannot Control Objectives.
• This unit ignores all keywords on destructable terrain. When moving over destructable terrain, destroy that terrain piece.
• This unit can only suffer a maximum of 2 Wounds from failing Panic Tests.
• When this unit is destroyed, before being removed, target 1 enemy it is engaged with. They suffer D3 Wounds.
This unit gains +1 to Morale Test rolls for each Game Round beyond the second Round.
When Charging, this unit's Attacks gain **Sundering**.
While you Control [HORSE], this unit gains +1 to Defense Dice Rolls and +1 [MOVEMENT].
Each time an enemy engaged with this unit fails a Panic Test, if this unit has 1 or more destroyed ranks, this unit restores 2 Wounds.

ORDER: HIT AND RUN.trigger: After this unit completes a Charge Action:
effect: This unit may perform 1 Retreat Action.

Before Deployment, place 1 Forest terrain with the Cover and Fortified keywords, or 1 Bog terrain with the Hindering and Rough Keywords anywhere on the battlefield and no closer than 1" to any other terrain piece.
When this unit Successfully Charges, target 1 enemy in Short Range, they become **Panicked**.
Each time this unit performs a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice choose 1 for each Condition token on the Defender:
• **Vicious**
• **Sundering**
• This unit may re-roll any Attack Dice.
Enemies successfully Charged by this unit lose all abilities until the end of the Turn.
This unit gains +1 to Morale Test rolls.
This unit cannot be influenced by NCUs.
While you Control [MONEY], enemies in Short Range of this unit suffer -1 to Morale Test rolls, this unit gains +1 to Morale Test rolls, and each time this unit Activates, it may restore 1 Wound.
While you Control [MONEY], this unit's Melee Attacks gain +1 to Hit.
This unit suffers -1 to Hit.

fluff.lore: Whether noble-born or ennobled, the Warrior’s Sons come from knightly backgrounds and devote their expertise in service to the Seven. Armed with shining swords, armored in heavy plate, and fortified by their unshakable faith, the Warrior’s Sons will reliably hold or advance upon any objective. When beset by impossible odds, the Sons are at their best, even when the situation might seem hopelessly desperate.

As watchmen for House Lannister’s seat of power, the Lannisport City Watch is armed and armored as well (if not better) than many front-line troops in the War of the Five Kings. That said, they’re not regular soldiers, and should not be relied upon to hold the vanguard or stand against a furious cavalry charge. That said, when in large numbers and properly supported, they remain effective and dangerous, a truly excellent support unit.

The vast castle at Casterly Rock serves as both a symbol of Lannister supremacy and an unbreakable fortress overlooking Lannisport. As such its guardians, the renowned Casterly Rock Honor Guard also serve as symbols of unbreakable Lannister might. Outfitted in the finest plate armor money can buy, and trained as a heavy response force to local threats, the Honor Guard can stand the line and exploit enemy vulnerabilities as they reveal themselves.

King’s Landing is generally considered a safe place to live, given that the aptly named Gold Cloaks can be seen patrolling avenues and alleyways from afar. They’re always ready to ensure that justice is served. As to whose justice that might be, however, the Lannisters rule King’s Landing, and the Gold Cloaks bend their knees to the Iron Throne. Speak ill of the king at your peril.

back_text.text: *Can only be fielded in an army containing Tyrion Lannister. He may be attached to this unit at no cost.*
back_text.name: Character

fluff.lore: As mountain tribes and raiders go, Tyrion Lannister’s Stone Crows are quite ordinary, save their unexpected loyalty. While pledged more to Tyrion’s coin than his person, they proved true to their word, even when betrayal might have been a more lucrative option. As mercenaries, these troops are worth their coin, if properly employed as scouts and flankers. Their light arms and armor make them unsuited to the front line in  a protracted engagement.

Hunters, woodsmen, and survivalists from the rugged north often serve their lords in one military capacity or another, but when the Direwolf marches to war, it brings more skilled bowmen than most. While marginally effective at short range, and very vulnerable in a pitched melee or a cavalry assault, House Stark’s bowmen will pin down or even outright eradicate enemy opposition at long range.

Umber Greataxes combine mobility, defense, and fearsome weaponry to field a unit with superior flexibility. Greataxes will chase down heavier foes, stand firm against charges, and deliver a devastating assault with their signature weapons. While not specialized in any particular combat doctrine, an experienced commander can deploy them as needed, to shore up exposed weaknesses in their own defenses or exploit an enemy’s poor judgment.

Heavily armed, heavily armored, and with all the speed that cavalry commands, House Tully’s Cavaliers are renowned for their devastating charges that can shatter even the hardest enemy line. The mere threat of an imminent charge forces enemy commanders to respond, allowing the Cavalier commander to project force against an enemy line without even engaging. A wise commander will have troops standing ready to exploit the chaos Cavaliers leave in their wake.

The She-Bears of House Mormont style their kit and tactics after the Lady Alysane Mormont. They’re powerful women, known for their strength, outfitted in thick leather and plate. Their weapons are two-handed maces, capable of crushing a heavy helm or caving in a chest plate in a single blow. The She-Bears are fanatically devoted to the Mormont cause, and their strong armor and resolve allow them to stand and fight where other units fall.

As befitting the house sigil of a great bear, the troops known colloquially as House Mormont Bruisers hit hard and go down fighting. Their light armor consists mostly of padded leather and light chain, giving them decent mobility. The last thing an opponent wants to face are these troops on a flank. When suffering losses, Bruisers only become more dangerous, vowing blood for blood and often taking their enemies with them.

House Karstark of Karhold is one of House Stark’s most faithful bannermen. When House Stark calls for aid, loyalist forces are quickly marshalled and sent into the field. While armed primarily with flails and shields, their main weapon is a truly steadfast belief in their cause. Wounds that might seem to put a man down will not bother them. They will simply refuse to break and run against a foe that they have a numerical advantage against.

The Crannogman Bog Devils are some of the most feared ambush soldiers in all of Westeros. Vassals of the Reed family, they are adept at blending in with swampy terrain. Their light armor keeps them from being bogged down in their chosen terrain, while their poisoned tridents deal an agonizing death to their foes. After an attack, the Bog Devils simply melt away back into the undergrowth, leaving nothing but the dead and dying.

Having loyally served in the military for several decades, the Winterfell Guards are formed of veterans in their prime. They have served as protectors of Winterfell for a time but have chosen to continue their service from within the city’s walls in their advanced years. However, in these days of War, they have been called upon yet again, to march on to the frontlines once more.

If anything, Wun Wun is larger even than his chief, Mag the Mighty. Wun Wun shares the vast strength and thick hide common to all giants, coupled with a personal sense of invulnerability and uncommon fighting spirit. Wun Wun can break even the heaviest enemy line with ease, although Free Folk commanders should take care to support his crushing advances, lest he be surrounded and stung to death by a thousand cuts.

back_text.text: *Your army may only include up to 2 Mammoths.*
back_text.name: Limited

fluff.lore: On the battlefield the War Mammoth is a fearsome sight bearing down on an enemy position. Its incredible strength and thick hide make it difficult to neutralize. Giants have been known to ride Mammoths into battle, though not enough Mammoths still exist in the world to form a true cavalry corps. But, those that battle on behalf of their masters are well-trained. It’s a rare event, but a panicked Mammoth is no one’s ally on the battlefield.

The Walrus clan are adept at hunting in the far, northern wastes beyond the Wall. Now, they bring their expertise south with the Free Folk as they seek out warmer climes and greener pastures. Their weighted harpoons are perfect for skewering both vicious beast and enemy soldier. Their knowledge of keeping prey on their lines keeps them nimble, and under constant maneuver to attack from unexpected angles against enemy formations.

What’s worse than facing giants in the line-of-battle? Facing giants hurling spears the size of tree trunks from afar. The Free Folk’s alliance with the giants brought their Spear Throwers into the fray, giving them what amounts to artillery made of flesh. Their weapons are crude, but not much finesse is needed for a wooden haft as thick as a large man’s torso. That said, these giants have trouble dealing with foes up close, and must be guarded.

North of the wall horses are a somewhat rare sighting, which makes Harma Dogshead’s Vanguard all the more inspiring for the Free Folk. While lightly armored and crudely armed compared to southern troops, these cavalry units serve as more than outriders, being both scouts and spearheads to the Free Folk armies. Their greatest weakness is in fact their lack of armor, but this gives rise to their greatest strength: pure speed.

Despite their outrageous appearance, the Bloody Mummers remain a deadly band of mercenaries, noted for their cruelty, itself excessive for even low-brow mercenaries. They’re loyal to coin alone, but meet their price and their ranks will fill whatever role an army requires. The Skirmishers are lightly armed and armored, granting them the mobility needed for rapid flanking, though they should be protected from direct charges.

A Stormcrow is a Stormcrow, whether wielding blade, bow, or both. Money remains the prime motivator in the Stormcrow mind, and extra coin can prod added effort from these mercenaries. Stormcrow Archers are adept in long-range combat, with recurved longbows and arrows made for distant flight. They’re not meant for melee, though their shortswords can fend off weakened attackers. Still, a wise commander will keep them far from flankers or cavalry.

Never lacking for outrageous flair, Bloody Mummer cavalry ride Zorses into battle. These unusual beasts originate from Essos, where striped animals and horses were interbred to create the species. Zorses can survive on little food and water for extended periods, but remain as swift as their western counterparts. Zorse Riders fill a classic light cavalry role in the Mummer ranks, flanking and charging pinned units and exposed archers.

So-called Hedge Knights travel the world in search of employment. Owning little but their arms, armor, and their horse, these landless nobles are shunned and disdained—except in times of war. With their blades for hire, and supplying their own equipment, nobles from all sides of the War of Five Kings can find a use for a half dozen or so trained knights on the battlefield. That said, their equipment rarely matches that of true knights.

The Golden Company is well known for their motto, “Our word is good as gold.” When hired on to fight, they make sure to give every penny’s worth on the battlefield. Their Swordsmen have trained relentlessly, letting them find any weak spot in an enemy’s defenses, exploiting it. Meanwhile, they almost never flee the field, even when faced with seemingly insurmountable odds, making them a sound investment for anyone with the coffers to afford them.

As mountain tribes and raiders go, Tyrion Lannister’s Stone Crows are quite ordinary, save their unexpected loyalty. While pledged more to Tyrion’s coin than his person, they proved true to their word, even when betrayal might have been a more lucrative option. As mercenaries, these troops are worth their coin, if properly employed as scouts and flankers. Their light arms and armor make them unsuited to the front line in  a protracted engagement.

While Sworn Brothers can confidently keep their place in the line, Veterans possess the arms and expertise to push the line forward. They’re skilled combatants, nigh impossible to break, and their personal kit consists of the best armor the Builders can forge. Even the most professional units the Seven Kingdoms can muster would find the Veterans difficult to thwart, let alone defeat.

As the mainstay of the Night’s Watch forces, the Sworn Brothers face Wildlings and other northern terrors with stoicism and reserve born of long-training and solid gear. Indeed, having their own forges and smiths allows the average Brother a better kit than the average foot soldier belonging to most great houses (except House Lannister, of course). Sworn Brothers can be relied upon to hold the line, almost regardless of the odds.

back_text.text: *Your army may only contain up to 2 Builder Scorpion Crews.*
back_text.name: Limited

fluff.lore: The Night’s Watch Builders are known for their ingenuity, and none embodies this more than the Builder Scorpion Crew. With just a few specialized parts, and enough available timber, the Crew can construct a mobile Scorpion, capable of firing massive bolts at long range and with surprising accuracy. Entire ranks can be cut down by a single projectile. However, the Scorpion itself requires time to reposition, and it moves very slowly.

back_text.text: *Your army may only contain up to 2 Builder Stone Throwers.*
back_text.name: Limited

fluff.lore: Builder Stone Thrower Crews are adept at constructing and operating mobile Stone Throwers in the field. The Builders insist these are not catapults, as those siege engines are typically on a larger scale and often use specialized projectiles, but the principles are the same. A competent Stone Thrower Crew can land their deadly projectiles dead-center in enemy formations, against which not even the heaviest of infantry have any protection.

While the Wall and its fortifications remain the Builders’ primary responsibility, they also service arms and armor for the entirety of the Night’s Watch. Thus, their role on the battlefield is not traditionally as front-line combatants. But in the face of some enemies, every man wants a weapon at hand. As crossbows require more attention to upkeep and maintenance than most weapons, the Builders are a natural choice to act as second-line fire support.

Somewhat ragged and often unruly, Night’s Watch Conscripts are literally the lowest of the low. While the Watch prefers to provide at least some training to their newest recruits, on occasion, defense of the Wall requires every man standing to grab a blade and sally forth. Liable to break and run at the first sign of serious resistance, a wise commander will not depend too heavily on the Conscripts holding against strong odds.

A mysterious specter that aids or hinders forces according to an unknown design, the entity known as Coldhands might be an ally one day and an enemy the next. He commands endless flocks of ravens to savage opponents with raking claws and battering wings, and rides a mighty elk into battle, where his own considerable prowess comes into play. He wears the armor and cloak of a Night’s Watch brother, though whether these were his in life or looted from a fallen foe, none can say. Even if cut down, Coldhands reappears on the field a short time later.

Stag Knights form the core of Baratheon elite units, each one a noble in their own right and wearing the signature horned helmet allowed to these honored sers. Stag Knights are heavily armored, wearing plate mail as fine as anything the Lannisters might field and wielding a powerful two-handed war hammer capable of crushing armor and shattering bones with equal proficiency. Even when surrounded, Stag Knights fight with unwavering fury.

While House Baratheon may be divided in its loyalties, they still draw from the same battlefield doctrines and training that served the united house in the time before the War of the Five Kings. Baratheon Wardens are heavily armored in full plate, wielding heavy shields and the signature Baratheon war hammers. Steadfast and sturdy, Wardens can be depended on as both vanguard and center, though speed is not among their strengths.

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

fluff.lore: As dedicated front-line units, the Rose Knights in service to King Renly come heavily armed and armored in the finest plate and brightest green that Renly’s extensive purse allows. Hard training and fierce loyalty to their king keep these troops standing and fighting, even in the face of dire wounds. A commander should take care to keep them from being surrounded, but Rose Knights can take the hardest hits and return them twice over.

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: STANNIS BARATHEON

fluff.lore: Although no one questions their steadfast belief in R’hllor, those of Stannis’ troops known as the Faithful do not each possess their own Lightbringer, the fabled blazing sword of Azor Ahai. Instead, their blades are set ablaze with a mixture of oils that produce a strong heat, albeit for a brief period. While not heavily armored, their zealous conviction allows them to stand strong against any foe, ensuring that even if they fall they will inspire those around them.

In-keeping with the Baratheon doctrine of heavy arms and heavier armor, Champions of the Stag are knights in full plate mail atop massive destriers. These juggernauts have all the mobility of cavalry and the staying power of front-line units. Intelligent commanders are best served keeping them mobile to force engagements of their own choosing, but, if needed, Champions can hold the line for longer than most other cavalry.

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: STANNIS BARATHEON

fluff.lore: The Queen’s Men of Stannis Baratheon’s court are so-named not specifically for their dedication to Queen Selyse, but for their conversion to the R’hllor faith (though some speculate that their true loyalty lies more towards the Red Priestess Melisandre). Queen’s Men are heavily-armored elite vanguard units, capable of blunting nearly any enemy assault. While suffering the usual slowness of heavy troops, theirs is a center that will hold.

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

fluff.lore: Highgarden is House Tyrell’s seat of power. Aiding House Baratheon’s claim on the Iron Throne, House Tyrell sent their Highgarden Pikemen. These highly trained fighters create a mobile wall of death on the battlefield, trained to perfection in the use of their pikes. Though lightly armored, the perseverance of the troops is without equal, making them a mainstay on the battlefield. Opponents can never truly count them out until all have been defeated.

While it would be easy to categorize the Dothraki as a mindless horde of screaming barbarians, their method of attack looks precisely as such to the untrained eye. A Dothraki khalasar can have many thousand horsemen, even the least of which has spent more of his life in the saddle than otherwise. Although lightly armored, Dothraki horsemanship is honed to such a degree that it’s difficult to land a blade on them, even when engaged in close melee.

Superior Dothraki horsemanship finds its pinnacle in the Dothraki Veterans. Adept with both blade and bow, Veterans soften up their chosen prey with deadly arrows before a brutal charge, slashing left and right with their razor-sharp arakhs. As adept as Dothraki horsemanship can be, the Veterans take this skill to unimaginable heights, with man and mount moving in perfect precision even in the midst of the fiercest melee.

Whatever one thinks of Ser Jorah Mormont’s personal dealings and checkered past, his skill-at-arms earned him respect among the Dothraki, no simple feat. As a veteran of multiple wars and later a sellsword, his expert eye can pick out vulnerabilities in the enemy ranks for nearby troops to exploit. Ser Jorah prefers to remain mounted in combat, and his horsemanship exceeds many of his Western counterparts.
fluff.quote: “There are ghosts everywhere. We carry them with us wherever we go.”

back_text.text: *Your army may only include up to 2 Dothraki Hrakkars.*
back_text.name: Limited

fluff.lore: Taming one of the great white lions of the Dothraki Sea is a feat accomplished by only the mightiest khalasars. These powerful beasts match even the famed Stark Direwolves in terms of conferred status, and a Hrakkar in war is just as fearsome a sight on the field. Fast, deadly, and above all stealthy, troops facing the Dothraki should beware of sudden attacks from unsuspected quarters by lurking Hrakkars.

A Stormcrow is a Stormcrow, whether wielding blade, bow, or both. Money remains the prime motivator in the Stormcrow mind, and extra coin can prod added effort from these mercenaries. Stormcrow Archers are adept in long-range combat, with recurved longbows and arrows made for distant flight. They’re not meant for melee, though their shortswords can fend off weakened attackers. Still, a wise commander will keep them far from flankers or cavalry.

The infamous Ironborn Reavers are known along coastlines across the Seven Kingdoms as raiders and pirates. Reavers crew their signature longships whose sails are a dread to all who spot them on the horizon. Although sailors to a man, the Ironborn wear light scale mail even aboard ship. They’re fast-attack troops, but not trained to stand under heavy assault. Commanders would do well to keep them off the front line.

Although the scythe is not generally a workable weapon in war, the infamous Reapers of House Harlaw have devised a form of long-bladed heavy bardiche reminiscent of their fearsome house sigil. The Reapers themselves are lightly armored troops renowned for their deadly ferocity. What good is armor when the morale of their foes has been utterly broken? When it comes to sowing terror across the battlefield, few compare to the Reapers.

The heavily armored troops from House Ironmaker often serve as the hard center of Ironborn forces where a dedicated line is required. With their heavy scale armor overlaying a thick suit of boiled leather, the Ironmakers can withstand even more assaults than most of the troops of the Iron Islands. That said, as ‘heavy troops’ go, the Ironmakers are the general equivalent of standard medium infantry, that is, until the spoils of the raid are gained!

Pillaging and raiding is the primary Ironborn motivation in the War of the Five Kings. Let the houses fight for the Iron Throne if they wish. The Ironborn have coasts to raid, treasure to seize, and people to enslave. As such the Ironborn Trappers excel at hindering enemy forces with their long, barbed pikes and entangling nets. While lightly armored and possessing only crude weapons, the trapper’s cunning and usage of devious tools more than makes up for this.

Of the different warriors that House Greyjoy sends to assault shoreline settlements, the Blacktyde Chosen are the most feared. When these elite warriors hit the beach, they rapidly form their ranks and sweep a path clear through any defences or defenders that stand in their way. Clad in scale mail, armed with master-crafted axes, and wielding large round shields, the Chosen are among the heaviest troops under the Kraken banner.

Those under the Kraken banner have long learned that raiding and terror are close companions. Thus the crew of House Greyjoy’s warship Silence is composed entirely of mutes. War is not a quiet business, but the Silenced Men add an unnatural stillness to the battlefield. Even in death, they make no sound. Even disciplined troops find such men unnerving. Though wearing only light armor, their honed greataxes can sunder heavy plate with ease.

The Kraken banner coming over the horizon often means trouble for denizens of the Stony Shore, in no small part thanks to the Pillagers the boats will bring. These men are used to moving quickly, seizing everything not nailed down, and killing or routing anyone that gets in their way. The killing momentum keeps them in the fight longer than many troops with similar gear, but care must be taken to support them against enemies bearing heavy arms.

The sight of Kraken sails coming over the horizon fills any settlement with dread, but none moreso than those of the Iron Victory, Victarion’s personal raiding ship. The Iron Victory’s Crew are handpicked men, vicious by nature, skilled in warfare, and loyal to a fault. They are few in number but can serve well as a hard center to any assault force. Proper support is required to guard their flanks, of course.

House Martell’s Sand Skirmishers turn their doctrine of high mobility into a deadly dance of blade and bow. Their light armor allows them superior speed, rivaling that of the fastest enemy units, and their training allows for deadly hit-and-fade attacks, all under a rain of incoming arrows. If locked down in a protracted melee, Skirmishers can hold their own as well as any light unit, but a wise commander will send relief as soon as possible.

Sunspear Dervishes raise House Martell’s doctrine of high mobility to a fine art. Their training allows them to rapidly engage, strike hard, and just as rapidly disengage to either prep for another run or choose a more opportune target. Enemies so besieged are often so rattled by the spinning, whirling dance of blades that their own response is badly hampered. While Dervishes can hold in a melee for a time, they’re best kept on-the-move.

The lands of Dorne seems like an endless sea of dunes. It’s easy to get lost in the shifting sands. But the Dune Vipers call this land home and know each grain of sand’s place. Using their knowledge of the terrain, they excel in guerilla tactics, harassing enemies with their nets and spears, ensnaring foes before heading in for the final strike. Best when paired with allies, the Dune Vipers can stand on their own when needs must.

Climate is an important factor when equipping and training an army. With the hot climate in Dorne, the Starfall Knights of House Dayne, vassals of House Martell, are more lightly armored than most heavy cavalry. However, what they lack in armor, they make up for in speed and maneuverability, letting them strike at opponents from unexpected quarters, applying their lances to devastating effect during charges.

The personal guard of Ser Gerold Dayne have no formal name but are simply known as Darkstar Retinue. And that’s enough to cause worry among enemy troops, for the Retinue is composed of soldiers that follow in the Darkstar’s footsteps in both manner and fighting style. They strike without warning, usually  on an unguarded flank, hit hard, then fade back to wait patiently  for another opening. That is, if they leave any.

House Bolton’s Spearmen are indoctrinated in the combat ethic of causing fear and panic among the enemy ranks. Their helmets and shields are designed with extra spikes purely for terrifying effect. The spearmen are trained to strike at points on foes that will cause maximum pain but not kill their opponents, leaving plenty of prisoners for the sadists in House Bolton to do with as they will after battle.

The Brotherhood Without Banners is technically an outlaw band, acting in service to any lord who fights for the realm’s justice, working towards bringing peace swiftly to the kingdoms. As such, they’re seen as idealists (and fanatics), and their Men-At-Arms are staunch professionals willing to fight to the bitterest of ends in the name of justice. They serve  best in the line, grinding the enemy to dust.

abilities.name: The Rains of Castamere
effect: Once per game, at the start of any Turn, target any number of enemy Combat Units:
• Up to 3 of those enemies gain 3 Condition tokens (total).
• 1 of those enemies loses all Abilities until the end of the Round.
*(The same Combat Unit may be targeted by multiple effects)*

fluff.quote: "Some battles are won with swords and spears, others with quills and ravens."

abilities.name: Unbiased Justice
effect: Once per game, at the start of any Turn, target any number of friendly Combat Units:
• 1 of those units restores 2 Wounds.
• 1 of those units removes all Condition tokens.
• 1 of those units may pivot, then perform a 2" shift.
• Until the end of the Round, 1 of those units Attacks using its highest Attack Die Value, and may re-roll any Attack Dice.
*(The same Combat Unit may be targeted by multiple effects)*

fluff.quote: "The gods shaped him to be a follower, not a leader." -Tyrion Lannister

abilities.name: Bravery in the Face of Death
effect: Eddard begins the game with 3 Order tokens on him.
Each time a friendly unit is performing a Panic Test, after rolling dice, you may remove 1 Order token from Eddard. If you do, that unit may re-roll any dice for this test.
Each time a friendly unit passes a Panic Test, you may remove 1 Order token from Eddard. If you do, that unit restores 1 Wounds, +1 Wound for each of its destroyed ranks.

fluff.quote: "You wear your honor like a suit of armor, Stark." -Petyr Baelish

abilities.name: Fury of the Thenns
effect: **Influence** *(When this unit Claims a zone, attach this card to a Combat Unit until the end of the Round):*
Each time Styr Influences a friendly unit, you may restore 1 Wound to that unit.
While Influencing a friendly unit, that unit's Melee Attacks roll +1 Attack Dice.

fluff.quote: "These are wildlings... more beast than man."

abilities.name: Spearwife Council
effect: Each time Dalla Claims a zone, perform the following based on the zone she Claimed:
[CROWN]: 1 enemy becomes **Weakened**.
[MONEY]: Instead of removing a Condition token, target 1 enemy engaged with that unit. They suffer 1 Hit, +1 Hit for each remaining rank in this unit.

[LETTER]: Instead of drawing cards, look at the top 2 cards of your opponent's Tactics deck. You may add one of those cards to your hand. Then, place the remaining cards on the top of the Tactics deck, in any order.

fluff.quote: "We free folk know things you kneelers have forgotten. Sometimes the short road is not the safest, Jon Snow."

abilities.name: Little Birds
effect: Varys begins the game with 4 Order tokens.
Each time an enemy NCU Claims a zone, after resolving that zone's effect, you may remove 1 Order token from Varys. If you do, gain the following based on that zone:
[CROWN]: 1 enemy suffers 1 Panic Test.
[MONEY]: Restore 2 Wounds to 1 friendly unit.
[LETTER]: Draw 1 Tactics card.
[SWORDS]: 1 enemy suffers 3 Hits.
[HORSE]: 1 friendly unit shifts 3".

fluff.quote: "Varys has ways of learning things that no man could know."

abilities.name: Counts and Measures
effect: Each time Bowen Claims a zone, you may look at the top 3 cards of your Tactics Deck. Place 1 of those cards in your hand, 1 of those at the top, and the other on the bottom of your Tactics Deck.

fluff.quote: "For the Watch."

abilities.name: Duty To The Realms Of Men
effect: Each time Jeor Claims a zone, you may target 2 friendly Night's Watch Combat Units. Move 1 friendly attached Tactics card from 1 of those units to the other.
Once per game, when Jeor Claims a zone, you may Take 1 Night's Watch Tactics card that can be attached to a unit from your discard pile and attach it to a friendly Night's Watch unit.

fluff.quote: "The Wall was made to guard the realms of men... and not against other men"

abilities.name: Gilly's Insight
effect: At the start of the game, after drawing your Tactics Hand, you may draw 1 Tactics Card, then shuffle 1 card from your hand into your Tactics Deck.

abilities.name: Samwell's Influence
effect: Gilly begins the game with 1 Order token. Each time Gilly Claims a zone, after resolving that zone's effect, remove 1 Order token from Gilly.
At the end of each Round, if Gilly has no Order token, destroy Gilly.

back_text.text: *May only be fielded in an army including Samwell Tarly.*
*If your army contains Samwell Tarly, Craven Scholar, reduce the cost of Gilly by 1.*

fluff.quote: "Well I think you're quite brave."

abilities.name: Rest and Refuge
effect: **Influence*** (When this unit Claims a zone, attach this card to a Combat Unit until the end of the Round)*:
Each time Craster Influences a unit, remove 1 Condition token from them.
While Influencing a unit, at the start of any Turn, you may remove this card and discard 1 friendly attached Night's Watch card from this unit. If you do, restore 2 Wounds to this unit.

fluff.quote: "The man's half-mad, I won't deny it, but you'd be the same if you'd spent your life in this cursed wood."

abilities.name: Rise Again, Blade in Hand
effect: Once per game, when Balon activates, instead of Claiming a Zone, redeploy 1 previously destroyed House Greyjoy Combat Unit fully within Long Range of a friendly Deployment Edge. It deploys without any Pillage tokens it previously had. If the unit had not Activated this Round, it deploys Unactivated. Otherwise, it deploys Activated.

fluff.quote: "No man has ever died from bending his knee. He who kneels may rise again, blade in hand."

abilities.name: Gifts of Iron, Gold, and Steel
effect: At the start of the game, place 1 Pillage token on Erik and 1 Pillage token on 1 friendly Greyjoy Combat unit.
When Erik or an enemy NCU claims [MONEY] place 1 Pillage token on Erik.
When Erik Claims a zone other than [MONEY], you may remove 1 Pillage token from him and place it on 1 friendly Greyjoy unit.

fluff.quote: "If old is wise, no one is wiser than me. If big is strong, no one's stronger."

abilities.name: Nightfire Visions
effect: You may look at the top card of your Tactics deck at any time. Once per game, at the start of any Turn, you may discard 1 Tactics card. If you do, draw 1 Tactics card.

abilities.name: R'hllor's Magics
effect: Once per game, at the start of any Turn, you may use this ability. If you do, until the end of the Turn, your opponent may not use Orders or Tactics cards.

fluff.quote: "Why do you say this man is a wizard? I see only a ragged red priest." -Victarion Greyjoy to Rodrik Sparr

abilities.name: Hot Tempered
effect: **Influence** *(When this unit Claims a zone, attach this card to a Combat Unit until the end of the Round)*:
While Influencing a friendly unit, each time an enemy Attacks this unit with a Melee Attack, after resolving that Attack, deal 2 Hits to the Attacker and attach 1 Dornish Poison card to them.

fluff.quote: "Oberyn has always been half mad." -Tywin Lannister

abilities.name: Healing Hands
effect: Each time Tyene Claims a zone, you may target 1 friendly Combat unit. They restore 1 Wound. If they are engaged with an enemy, and that enemy has a Poison card attached to it, restore 2 Wounds instead.
At the Start of Round 2, choose 1 Tactics Zone. The next time an enemy NCU Claims that zone, attach **The Strangler** Posion card to that NCU.
[SKILL:Venom]

fluff.quote: "White suits my coloring. I look so ... pure."

abilities.name: Loyal Imposter
effect: **Influence** *(When this unit Claims a zone, attach this card to a Combat Unit until the end of the Round)*.
While Influencing a unit, that unit gains +2 to Morale Test rolls.
Once per game, at the start of any Round, you may become the First Player. If you do, Jeyne cannot Activate that Round.

fluff.quote: "I pray that I will make you a good wife and give you strong sons to follow after you."

abilities.name: Deceitful Envoy
effect: Tybald begins the game with 3 Order tokens on him.
Each time an enemy NCU Activates, if Tybald is not on the Tactics Board, you may remove 1 Order token from Tybald. If you do, target 1 zone.
If that NCU Claims that zone, after resolving that zone's effect, 1 enemy Combat Unit becomes **Vulnerable**.
If that NCU does not Claim that zone this Turn, at the end of the Turn, you may Activate Tybald and Claim that zone.

fluff.quote: "Isn't it clever how the maesters go only by one name, even those who had two when they first arrived at the Citadel?"

abilities.name: Prophecies and Portents
effect: **Influence** *(When this unit Claims a zone, attach this card to a Combat Unit until the end of the Round)*:
While Influencing a unit, that unit gains +1 to Morale Test rolls.
Each time a rank in that unit is destroyed, 1 enemy they are engaged with becomes **Vulnerable** or **Weakened**.

fluff.quote: "She has her own ways of knowing things, that one. The weirwoods whisper in her ear when she sleeps."

back_text.text: *May not be fielded in an army that includes the Kingsguard unit.*

fluff.quote: "Once they were a marvel, a shining lesson to the world..." -Bran Stark
"No one could ever withstand Gregor."
"That beast's head would make a noble gift for all the people of the realm, I vow." -Brynden Tully

back_text.text: *Before Deployment, attach Jaime to an enemy Infantry unit, ignoring the usual Attachment restrictions.*

fluff.quote: "What they did to him was unspeakably cruel."
"My son. How could I have made a son like that, Ned?." -Robert Baratheon
"I should welcome the chance to try my own steel against this Stark boy."
"Your father once told me that the Greatjon was as fearless as any man he had ever known."
"No sword is strong until it’s been tempered."
"No one knows the lands of the North quite as well as Brynden."
"It is no good hammering your sword into a plowshare if you must forge it again on the morrow."

back_text.text: *Your army may only contain up to 2 Crannogman Survivalist.*
back_text.name: Limited

back_text.text: *Crannogman Survivalist ignores the usual Attachment restrictions when added to Crannogman units.*
*Reduce the cost of 1 Crannogman Survivalist in your army by 1.*

fluff.quote: "You never see them, but they see you. Those who go into the bogs after them get lost and never come out."
"Make no mistake, Robb—these are your bannermen, not your friends." -Catelyn Stark
"In war you kill your enemies. Didn't your father teach you that, boy?"
"Like as not, my sister is marching in your brother’s host, her and those daughters of hers, dressed in men’s mail" -Jeor Mormont to Jon Snow
"He seemed to me the sort of man who would make a good friend and a bad enemy."
"Now bring out the mead!"
"I'll keep his head for my standard. A turncloak's worse than a dog."
"Cutting out the eyes, that's the Weeper's work. The best crow's a blind crow, he likes to say."
"Men can’t own the land no more’n they can own the sea or the sky."

back_text.text: *Jarl ignores the usual Attachment limits.*

fluff.quote: "The Wall defends itself."
"Men are men and women women, no matter which side of the Wall we were born on." -Lady Val
"A savage folk. The men are bad, the women worse." -Tormund Giantsbane
"A true knight is sworn to protect those who are weaker than himself, or die in the attempt."
"You want a nose like mine?  Fight me, and you'll get one."

back_text.text: *May only be fielded in an army containing Rorge.*
*This Attachment ignores the usual Attachment restrictions when added to a Bloody Mummer unit.*

fluff.quote: "His tongue had been cut and  he does not speak, except to hiss."
"The Stormcrows do not stand alone."  -Prendahl
"The only gods he worshipped were honor and duty."
"A one-armed smith slew Mag the Mighty? Har! That must o' been a fight to see."
"The Night's Watch is a sworn brotherhood. We have no families."

back_text.text: *This Attachment ignores the usual Attachment restrictions.*

fluff.quote: "They killed him long ago."
"Dead meat, dry blood, a faint whiff of rot. And cold. Cold over all."
"There's not a man on the Wall knows the haunted forest better than Benjen Stark."
"Do not make me die regretful."

back_text.text: *Davos ignores the usual Attachment Limits*

fluff.quote: "He makes me wish I had more smugglers in my service. And fewer lords." -Stannis Baratheon
"The Estermont's loyalty to Stannis is without question."
"As in so much else, Renly was like his brother Robert, and utterly unlike Stannis."

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

fluff.quote: "Ser Loras is so Tyrell he pisses rosewater" -Cersei Lannister
"It takes a certain cunning to reach his age"

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

fluff.quote: "Gold is cold and heavy on the head, but so long as I am the king, I have a duty..."
"Small wonder the lords gather around him with such fervor, she thought, he is Robert come again." -Catelyn Stark's thoughts

attachment.name: Loras Tyrell
attachment.title: Lord Commander of the Rainbow Guard

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

fluff.quote: "Under all his flowers and finery, Ser Loras is as hot tempered as Jaime Lannister." -Petyr Baelish

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

back_text.text: *May not be fielded in an army that includes the Rainbow Guard unit.*

fluff.quote: "Away from him, you vile creature!"

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

back_text.text: *May not be fielded in an army that includes the Rainbow Guard unit.*

fluff.quote: "A second son must find glory where he can. A man grows weary of tourneys."

back_text.text: *Your army may never contain Units or Attachments with different Loyalties.*
back_text.name: Loyalty
back_text.heading: RENLY BARATHEON

back_text.text: *May not be fielded in an army that includes the Rainbow Guard unit.*

fluff.quote: "His only wish was to command the vanguard."
"The Dothraki follow only the strong."
"I vow to serve you, to obey you, to die for you if need be. Whatever may come."
"I am a knight. I shall die a knight."
"I let each man cut me once, before I kill him. Count the cuts and you will know how many Strong Belwas has slain."
"Why do the gods make kings and queens, if not to protect the ones who can't protect themselves?"
"As you say, I do, blood of my blood."

back_text.text: *May not be fielded in an army that includes the "Drogo's Bloodriders" unit.*

fluff.quote: "The Dothraki say a man and his bloodriders share one life..."

back_text.text: *May not be fielded in an army that includes the "Drogo's Bloodriders" unit.*

fluff.quote: "They were the khal's brothers, his shadows, his fiercest friends."

back_text.text: *May not be fielded in an army that includes the "Drogo's Bloodriders" unit.*

fluff.quote: "'Blood of my blood', Drogo called them, and so it was; they shared a single life."
"I am the heir of Balon's body."
"Wizards may be well and good, but blood and steel win wars."
"I pay the iron price. I will take my crown, as Urron Redhand did five thousand years ago."
"King Erik, aye, I like the sound o' that. Come, say it with me. ERIK! ERIK ANVIL-BREAKER! ERIK KING!"
"I am Asha of House Greyjoy, aye. Opinions differ on whether I'm a lady."
"The living should smile, for the dead cannot."
"I'm going to kill that."
"Give me back my spear, Uncle."
"She is chasing after something she can never catch" -Areo Hotah

back_text.text: *Quentyn Martell ignores the usual Attachment limits.*

fluff.quote: "This will be my grand adventure."

back_text.text: *This Attachment may only be Attached to Martell units.*

fluff.quote: "I am of the night."
"Of all the knights in Dorne, why did my father chose this one to be my shield?" -Arianne Martell
"I was weaned on venom"

back_text.text: *Reduce this Attachment's cost by 1 if attached to a unit of Bastard's Girls.*
*This Attachment ignores the usual Attachment limits.*

fluff.quote: "If they lead him a good chase, he may name his next litter after them."

back_text.text: *The first Bastard's Boy Attachment included in your army is free.*

fluff.quote: "No pain Theon had ever known came close to the agony that Skinner could evoke with a little flensing blade."
"Blunt, brusque, brutal, at heart a simple soldier..."
"You ride with the Dondarrion. The lightning lord."

back_text.text: *Reduce the cost of the first attachment included in your army by 1.*

fluff.quote: "He isn't very priestly, is he?" -Arya Stark

back_text.text: *Reduce the cost of the first attachment included in your army by 1.*

fluff.quote: "Anguy here could put three shafts through you before you could hope to reach us."

back_text.text: *Edric Dayne may be included in a unit containing Thoros of Myr, ignoring the usual attachment restrictions.*

fluff.quote: "I'm only twelve."

text.trigger: When an enemy Combat Unit Activates:
effect: That enemy becomes **Panicked**.
If you Control [CROWN], they lose 1 ability until the end of the Turn.
If you Control [MONEY], they cannot be targeted by friendly Tactics cards until the end of the Turn.

text.trigger: When an enemy in Long Range of Jaime Lannister's unit Activates:
effect: That enemy become **Panicked**.

If that enemy could Attack or Charge Jaime Lannister's unit, and declares any Action other than an Attack or Charge on Jaime Lannister's unit this Turn, before performing that Action, that enemy becomes **Vulnerable** and **Weakened**.

text.trigger: Start of any Turn:
effect: Draw 1 Tactics card.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: This Attack gains +2 Attack Dice and **Sundering**.
If this Attack did not destroy at least 2 of the Defender's ranks, the Attacker becomes **Vulnerable**.

tactics.name: Traitors! I Will Have Their Heads!

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Target 1 enemy Combat Unit and attach this card to them.
While attached, Melee Attacks against this unit gain **Vicious**.
At the end of the Round, if this unit has not been destroyed, remove this card from them, and each unit that attacked them this Round becomes **Panicked**.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Melee Attack, after Defense Dice are rolled:
effect: Target the Defender. They block +2 Hits. After this Attack has been completed, the Defender becomes **Weakened**.

text.trigger: After a friendly unit passes a Panic Test:
effect: All enemies in Short Range of that unit become **Vulnerable**. Attach this card to that unit until it fails a Panic Test.

While Attached, each time this unit passes a Panic Test, all enemies in Short Range of that unit become **Vulnerable**. If this card is attached to Brynden Tully's unit, it gains +1 to Panic Test rolls.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit. That unit performs 1 Morale Test.
On a success, target 1 enemy in Long Range. It becomes **Panicked** or **Vulnerable**.
If this is a Tully unit, on a success, it becomes **Panicked** and **Vulnerable** instead.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: The Attacker suffers 1 Hit for each Miss.
If the Defender is Rodrik's unit, this Attack also suffers -1 to Hit.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Ranged Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: The Defender gains +1 to Defense Dice rolls.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit is performing an Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: Choose 1. For each Condition token on the Defender, choose +1:
•This Attack rolls its highest Attack Die Value.
•This Attack gains +1 to Hit.
•The Defender loses all Abilities and cannot be the target of friendly Tactics cards until the end of the Turn.

text.trigger: When an enemy Combat unit Activates:
effect: If that enemy is in Long Range of a friendly Crannogman unit, it suffers -2[MOVEMENT] this Turn.
Target 1 terrain piece. Until the end of the Round, enemies treat that terrain as having the Dangerous keyword.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit performs a Charge Action, before rolling Charge Distance dice:
effect: This unit automatically counts as rolling a 6 on all Charge Distance dice and their Melee Attack gains **Critical Blow**.
After this Attack has been completed, unless the Attacker is Rickard Karstark's unit, they become **Vulnerable**.

text.trigger: Start of any Turn:
effect: Attach this card to 1 friendly Infantry unit until the end of the game.
Each time this unit destroys an enemy rank, place 1 Order token on this card.
Enemies engaged with this unit suffer -1 to Panic tests for each Order token on this card, up to -2.

text.trigger: Start of any Turn:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit and attach this card to them until the end of the game. When a friendly rank is destroyed, place 1 Order token on this card.
While this card has a token, the attached unit gains:
When this unit Attacks, before Attack Dice are rolled, the Defender becomes **Vulnerable**.

text.trigger: Start of an enemy Turn:
effect: Select either Shadowcat or Wolf Pack. If that unit is on the battlefield, you may remove it from the battlefield.
After, if that unit is not on the battlefield *(from either this effect or having been destroyed)*, redeploy it fully within Short Range of any Flank table edge. It deploys Activated.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Attach this card to 1 friendly Cavalry or Infantry unit until the end of the game.

While attached, each time this unit destroys an enemy rank, place 1 Order token on this card. When this unit performs a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice, you may expend any number of Order tokens from this card. For each token spent, choose 1:
• This Attack may re-roll any Attack Dice
• This Attack rolls its highest Attack Die Value
• The Defender cannot be the target of friendly Orders this turn
• The Defender becomes **Vulnerable**

text.trigger: Start of any Round:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit. That unit performs 1 Attack Action.
If this targets a Bloody Mummer unit, it gains +1 to Hit.
After completing that Attack, your opponent may Activate 1 NCU.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Attach this card to a friendly Stormcrow Combat Unit until they fail a Panic Test.
While attached, each time this unit Attacks, before rolling Attack Dice, choose 1 for each other friendly unit in Short Range. If they are in Short Range of Jokin’s unit, choose +1:
• This Attack gains **Vicious**
• This Attack gains +1 to Hit
• This Attack rolls +1 Attack Dice

text.trigger: After a friendly unit completes a Melee Attack:
effect: If the Defender suffered any Wounds, the attacker restores 2 Wound, +1 additional Wound for each rank they destroyed with this attack. If an Infantry Attachment was destroyed, you may also take it and attach it to the Attacker, replacing a model as normal, but ignoring the usual Attachment limits.

text.trigger: When a friendly Night's Watch Combat Unit Activates:
effect: That unit performs 1 Morale Test. If that unit has no friendly attached cards, they automatically pass this test. On a success, choose 1:
• Search your Tactics Deck for any 1 Tactics card and add it to your hand, then discard 1 card. Shuffle your Tactics Deck.
• Search your Tactics Deck or discard pile for any 1 Tactics card that can be attached to this unit and attach it to this unit. Shuffle your Tactics Deck.

tactics.name: It Shall Not End Until My Death!

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Attach this card to a friendly Combat Unit until the end of the game.
While attached, when this unit would be destroyed, you may discard this card. If you do, this unit is not destroyed, but instead remains in play with 1 Wound.

text.trigger: After a friendly unit passes a Panic Test:
effect: All enemies in Short Range of that unit become **Vulnerable**. Attach this card to that unit until it fails a Panic Test.
While Attached, each time this unit passes a Panic Test, all enemies in Short Range of that unit become **Vulnerable**. If this card is attached to Donal Noye's unit, it gains +1 to Panic Test rolls.

text.trigger: Start or end of any Round:
effect: Place 1 Low Wall terrain with the Destructible, Fortified, and Hindering keywords within 1" of a friendly unit. This terrain cannot overlap units or other terrain.

text.trigger: After an enemy completes an Attack:
effect: Choose 1. If you Control [CROWN] or [LETTER], choose +1:
• That enemy becomes **Weakened**.
• That enemy becomes **Panicked** and **Vulnerable**.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Target 2 friendly Infantry units in Long Range of each other. Remove up to 4 models from 1 of these units. Restore that many Wounds to the other.
You may then move 1 Attachment from 1 of these units to the other *(replacing 1 model as usual, and keeping usual Attachment restrictions)*, or switch 2 friendly Attachments in those units.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: The Defender performs 1 Morale Test. On a success, the Attacker becomes **Vulnerable** and **Weakened**.

text.trigger: After a friendly unit not containing Eldon completes an Action:
effect: Eldon's unit performs 1 Maneuver Action.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: The Attacker suffers 1 Hit for each Miss.
If the Defender is Eldon’s unit, this Attack also suffers -1 to Hit.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Ranged Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: The Defender gains +1 to Defense Dice rolls.

text.trigger: When a friendly NCU Claims a zone:
effect: Replace that zone's effect with:
*Choose 1:*
*• Each friendly Combat Unit may pivot and shift 2".*
*• Restore 3 Wounds (total) across any number of friendly Combat Units.*
*• Remove all Condition tokens from each friendly Combat Unit. For each token removed, deal 1 enemy engaged with that unit 1 Wound.*

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Choose 2:
• Target all friendly units in Short Range of Renly Baratheon's unit. They restore 1 Wound.
• Target all enemies in Short Range of Renly Baratheon's unit. They suffer 1 Wound.
• Target all enemies in Short Range of Renly Baratheon's unit. They gain 1 Condition token.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Draw 1 Tactics card.

tactics.name: Will Of The One True King

text.trigger: When a friendly NCU Claims a zone:
effect: Replace that zone's effect with:
*1 enemy Combat Unit becomes **Panicked**.*
*1 enemy Combat Unit becomes **Vulnerable**.*
*1 enemy Combat Unit becomes **Weakened**.*

text.trigger: Start or end of any Round:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit. Attach this card to that unit until the end of the game.
While attached, each time this unit is performing a Melee Attack, after rolling Attack Dice, you may expend 1 Condition Token from the Defender. If you do, this Attack deals +1 Wound.
If this targets Stannis' unit, it deals +2 Wounds instead.

text.trigger: After an enemy completes an Attack:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit other than the Defender. They perform 1 Maneuver Action. If this targets Davos' unit, it may pivot then perform 1 March Action instead.

text.remove: Before the game begins, remove the "Final Strike" Tactics card from your Tactics Deck and replace it with this card.

text.trigger: When a friendly Combat Unit Activates:
effect: That unit cannot perform Actions this Turn. Target 1 enemy in Short Range. It Activates but does not perform any Actions.
You may choose 1:
• Both units restore 2 Wounds.
• Both units remove all Condition tokens.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: This Attack gains **Vicious** and rolls its highest Attack Die Value.

text.trigger: When an enemy Combat Unit Activates:
effect: That enemy suffers 1 Panic Test with -1 to their roll for each enemy R'hllor unit in Short Range. On a failure, in addition to suffering Wounds, they also become **Vulnerable** and **Weakened**.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit is Attacked, after rolling Attack Dice:
effect: Target 1 other friendly unit in Short Range of the Defender. That unit suffers up to 4 Hits from this Attack instead of the Defender.
If the Defender suffers Wounds from this Attack, you may also have that unit suffer the Panic Test from this Attack instead of the Defender.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit is performing a Charge Action, after rolling Charge Distance Dice:
effect: Enemies Successfully Charged by this unit become **Panicked** and **Vulnerable**.
If this targets Stannis's unit, this unit may re-roll any Charge Distance Dice.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit performs a Maneuver Action, before resolving that Action:
effect: This unit gains +3 [MOVEMENT] for that Maneuver Action.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: Target the Defender. They remove all Condition tokens.
Target another friendly Combat unit in Short Range. That unit restores 3 Wounds.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit is performing a Charge Action, before rolling Charge Distance Dice:
effect: This unit performs 1 Morale Test. If this targets Renly's unit, they automatically pass this test.
On a success, this unit automatically counts as rolling a 6 on all Charge Distance Dice.
On a failure, this unit may re-roll any Charge Distance Dice.

text.trigger: When an enemy NCU Claims a Zone:
effect: After resolving that zone's effect, move that NCU to any empty zone.
Target 1 enemy Combat unit. That enemy gains 1 Condition token.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit passes a Panic Test from being Attacked by a Melee Attack:
effect: Target the Attacker. They suffer 2 Hits for each remaining rank in this unit.
If the Defender was Belwas' unit, they also become **Weakened**.

text.remove: Before the game begins, remove the "Sudden Retreat" Tactics card from your Tactics Deck and replace it with this card.

text.trigger: After an enemy completes a Melee Attack:
effect: Target the Defender. For each blocked Hit, the Attacker suffers 1 Hit.
If the Defender is Belwas' unit, the Attacker suffers -1 to Defense Dice rolls for these Hits.

text.trigger: After an enemy completes a Melee Attack:
effect: Target the Defender. Attach this card to them until the end of the Game. When this card is attached, and each time an enemy completes an Attack against this unit, place 1 Order token on this card.
While attached, this unit's Melee Attacks gain the following, based on the number of tokens on this card:
• **1+:** This unit rolls its highest Attack Die Value, and may re-roll any Attack Dice.
• **2+: Vicious**
• **3+: Sundering**
• **4+: Critical Blow**

text.trigger: After a friendly unit within Long Range of Barristan rolls Defense Dice:
effect: That unit blocks +2 Hits. If this unit rolled Defense Dice as a result of being Attacked, it automatically passes the Panic Test from this Attack.

text.trigger: Start of any Turn:
effect: Draw 1 Tactics card.

text.trigger: When a friendly Combat Unit passes a Panic Test:
effect: Attach this card to that unit until it fails a Panic Test.
While attached, this unit's Melee Attacks gain **Sundering** and +1 to Hit.
When this card is removed, this unit becomes **Weakened** and **Vulnerable**.

text.trigger: When an enemy is Performing an Attack, after rolling Defense Dice:
effect: Attach this card to that enemy until the end of the game.
While attached, each time this unit is Attacked, the Attacker gains **Vicious**.
Each time this unit is Attacked, if the Attacker is Grey Worm's unit or an Unsullied unit, this unit also becomes **Vulnerable**.

text.trigger: When an enemy Attacks a friendly Drogon, Rhaegal, or Viserion unit, after rolling Defense Dice:
effect: Target the Defender.
The Defender only suffers 1 Wound for every 2 unblocked Hits.

text.remove: Before the game begins, remove the "Field Control" Tactics card from your Tactics Deck and replace it with this card.

text.trigger: When an enemy NCU Activates:
effect: That NCU cannot Claim [CROWN] this Turn.
If that NCU Claims any zone, Target 1 enemy Combat unit. That enemy gains 1 Condition token.

text.trigger: When an opponent plays a Tactics card, before resolving that Tactics card:
effect: Roll a die: On a 3+, cancel the effect of that Tactics Card.
If you Control [CROWN] or [SWORDS], cancel the effect of that Tactics card on a 2+ instead.
If you Control both, this roll automatically succeeds.

text.remove: Before the game begins, remove the "Unstoppable Advance" Tactics card from your Tactics Deck and replace it with this card.

text.trigger: When an enemy Combat Unit Activates:
effect: That enemy becomes **Panicked**.
If you Control [CROWN], they lose 1 ability until the end of the Turn.
If you Control [SWORDS], they cannot be targeted by friendly Tactics cards until the end of the Turn.

text.trigger: After a friendly unit completes a Melee Attack:
effect: If this Attack destroyed an enemy rank, place 1 Corpse Pile with the **Hindering** and **Horrific** keywords anywhere fully in Short Range and not overlapping other Terrain.
If this Attack destroyed the enemy, it gains the following keyword instead of **Horrific**:
• **Grim Reminder:** Enemies suffer -1 to Morale Test rolls and +1 Wound from failing Panic Tests while in Short Range.

text.trigger: Start of any Round:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit. That unit performs 1 Attack Action.
If this targets a Stormcrow unit, it gains +1 to Hit.
After completing that Attack, your opponent may Activate 1 NCU.

text.remove: Before the game begins, remove the "Fire and Blood" Tactics card from your Tactics Deck and replace it with this card.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit. That unit performs 1 Morale Test.
On a success, target 1 enemy in Long Range. It becomes **Panicked** or **Vulnerable**.
If this is Marselen's unit or an Unsullied unit, on a success, it becomes **Panicked** and **Vulnerable** instead.

text.trigger: When a friendly unit is performing a Panic Test, after rolling dice:
effect: That unit may re-roll any dice for this test. If that unit is in Short Range of Asha's unit, they pass this test instead.
If that unit is not Asha's unit, and that unit passes this test, Asha's unit also counts as having passed a Panic Test.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat unit. That unit performs 1 Morale Test.
On a success, target 1 enemy in Long Range. It becomes **Panicked** or **Vulnerable**.
If this targets Asha's unit, on a success, it becomes **Panicked** and **Vulnerable** instead.

text.trigger: Start of any Turn:
effect: Discard 1 other Tactics card. If you do, take 1 card from your opponent's discard pile and add it to your hand.
Return that card to your opponent's discard pile if it leaves your hand.
Replace any Commander Name on that card with Euron Greyjoy.

text.trigger: When a friendly Combat Unit Activates:
effect: That unit cannot perform Actions this Turn. Instead, 1 other friendly Combat Unit performs 1 Maneuver, March, or Retreat Action.
If either unit is Euron Greyjoy's unit, before performing this Action, 1 enemy in Long Range of Euron's unit becomes **Panicked**.

text.trigger: When an enemy NCU Activates:
effect: Target 1 Tactics Zone.
The next time that zone is Claimed this Round, after resolving that zone's effect, the player who did not Claim that zone may immediately activate that zone's effect.

text.trigger: Start of any Round:
effect: Target 1 friendly Combat Unit. They perform 1 March Action.

text.trigger: When a friendly Combat Unit Activates:
effect: That unit cannot perform Actions this Turn. Target 1 enemy in Short Range. It Activates but does not perform any Actions.
You may choose 1:
• Both units restore 2 Wounds.
• Both units remove all Condition tokens.

text.trigger: When a friendly NCU Claims [CROWN]:
effect: Replace that zone's effect with:
*Each enemy Combat Unit becomes **Panicked** or **Vulnerable**.*

text.trigger: After an enemy completes a Melee Attack:
effect: Target Obara's unit. It performs 1 Attack or Charge Action. If the Defender was destroyed, Obara's unit may re-roll any Attack and Charge Distance Dice.

text.trigger: Start of a friendly Turn:
effect: Draw 1 Tactics card.

text.trigger: When an enemy NCU Activates:
effect: Target 1 zone on the Tactics Board.
If that NCU Claims this zone, Gerold Dayne's unit may perform 1 Charge Action.

text.trigger: Start of any Turn:
effect: Draw 1 Tactics card.

text.trigger: When an enemy is performing a Melee Attack, before rolling Attack Dice:
effect: The Defender performs 1 Morale Test. On a success, the Attacker becomes **Vulnerable** and **Weakened**.

text.trigger: When a friendly Attachment would be destroyed:
effect: Instead of being destroyed, place that attachment in a Combat Unit of the same type, ignoring the usual Attachment restrictions *(but replacing a model as normal)*.

text.trigger: When a friendly Combat unit loses a rank:
effect: Target 1 friendly unit in Short Range. Remove all Condition tokens from them.

text.trigger: Start of any Turn:
effect: Draw 1 Tactics card.

text: Each time a House Greyjoy unit destroys an enemy rank with a Melee Attack, after that Attack is completed, it gains 1 Pillage token. A unit may have up to 2 Pillage tokens at any time.

That unit gains the following based on the number of Pillage tokens *(effects are cumulative)*:
• **1+:** +1 to Morale Test rolls.
• **2+:** +1 Attack Die.

note: **There can only be 1 Water Gardens in the Game. While you Control this zone, opponents do not count as Controlling Tactics Zones for Abilities or Tactics cards.**
effect: On your opponent's next Turn, they must Activate a Combat Unit if possible.

text: If your army includes Doran Martell, before the game begins, place the Water Gardens Tactics zone card next to the Tactics Board. It acts as an additional Tactics Zone for all purposes.
Each time this unit performs an Action, before resolving that Action, it suffers 1 Wound, +1 Wound if it has any Condition tokens on it.
If this unit would ever remove a Condition token, you may remove this card instead of that token.

back.quote:
"No true man killed with poison. Poison was for cravens, women, and Dornishmen."
-Victarion Greyjoy
text: **At the Start of the Game, place this card close to your Tactics Deck.**
An Ability or effect will state when this card will be played.
You may select Vargo Hoat as the Commander for your army.
You may include the following Neutral units and attachments in your army as if they were Bolton:
• Rorge, The Mad Dog of Saltpans
• Walder Frey, Lord of the Crossing
